OctetString (FB)
OctetString (FB)
Â¶
FUNCTION_BLOCK FINAL OctetString EXTENDS
Point
DNP3 datapoint of type Octet String.
An instance of AnalogInput does represent an instance of a datapoint of DNP3 object group 110 âoctet stringsâ.
Please be aware, that - as opposed to other DNP3 object group definitions - an instance of DNP3 object group 110 âoctet stringsâ
allows for DNP3 master read / write access. Master write access can be disabled using enableWrite.
In contrast to all other DNP3 object groups which support command / write,
a datapoint DNP3 object group 110 âoctet stringsâ is meant to write to the same memory than to read from.
This may not be practical within a PLC application, most obviously because the write will happen from another task context (the low level DNP3 stack) without any synchronization
with your IEC application. So OctetString distinguishes between memory to read from and memory to write to.
In case master write access is enabled (enableWrite=TRUE),
pBufOut/pLengthOut is written by a master write operation, thus signaled by writeActive.
An active master write can be reset using resetWrite, thus setting pLengthOut^ to 0.
InOut:
Scope
Name
Type
Initial

Input
Description
STRING
Description of the datapoint - this is a configuration,
changes are ignored after Outstation was enabled.
Point
Number
DINT
-1
Point number - this is a configuration, changes are ignored after Outstation was enabled..
The point number can be configured if needed to either:
start with Point number > 0
have gaps in Point numbers
If set to -1 (the default) the OutstationDataModel (more precisely the related âGroupâ) takes care to set the Point number internally:
starting at 0, if first Point number is not set explicitly.
increment by 1
In case you set Point number explicitly please keep it consistent:
Point numbers need to be >= 0
Point numbers need to be ascending
Point

Constants.TMWDEFS_CLASS_MASK_ONE

Operational event class may be changed by a master.
